intro: Gamochaeta serpyllifolia, commonly known as silverweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which results from dense covering of fine hairs. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, stream banks, and disturbed areas. Gamochaeta serpyllifolia is a perennial herb that spreads through rhizomes, making it both persistent and adaptable in various environments.
